title: How to Learn Lightsaber Combat Styles

steps.headline: Use heavy, sweeping blows to attack an enemy.
steps.description: Imagine you're trying to hit them with a sledgehammer.

steps.headline: Take it slow and focus on precision.
steps.description: The Strong style emphasizes strength and precision over speed.

steps.headline: Use acrobatics if you can.
steps.description: This style does draw some elements from Ataru, the most acrobatic of the classical forms.

steps.headline: Don't keep your lightsaber close to your body.
steps.description: Reach out as far as you can (without overreaching) to hit your enemies.

steps.headline: Use this style in lightsaber-to-lightsaber combat.
steps.description: Because of its emphasis on strength over speed, this style is not good for combating blaster fire.

steps.headline: Make quick, light blows.
steps.description: Try to get in as many attacks in as short a space of time as possible.

steps.headline: Keep your lightsaber in close.
steps.description: Don't reach out. This helps to increase your defense.

steps.headline: Don't go for many acrobatics.
steps.description: Use them if you have to, but be as fast as you can.

steps.headline: Use this style for blast deflection.
steps.description: The Fast style shares a weakness with Makashi: it's very easy for a strong opponent to bash through your defense.

steps.headline: Try to find a balance between speed and strength.
steps.description: Use whichever is more suitable for the task at hand.

steps.headline: The Medium style is intended as a balance between the other two styles.
steps.description: It is very similar to Niman.

steps.headline: Make sure that you are able to quickly switch between attack and defense, and also fast attacks and strong attacks.
